text: PEOPLE, PLACES AND SPACES 14.179 Part 4 of the policy also sets out general criteria for the placement of telephone kiosks. BACK TO POLICIES Policy PS11 Siting and design of telecommunications infrastructure 1. Where new sites are proposed for the installation of telecommunications equipment, it must be demonstrated that colocation or mast-sharing on existing telecommunications installations has been explored and is not possible. 2. The installation of new telecommunications apparatus is required to minimise its impact on the street scene and townscape and not unacceptably harm the appearance of heritage assets or unacceptably detract from the amenity of surrounding properties.
